snippet: In American Legion halls across the country, old age, apathy and budget deficits have become the enemies of an organization seeking to overhaul its image and increase membership.
abstract: American Legion faces old age, apathy and budget deficits as it seeks to overhaul its image and increase membership, which is down 11 percent since 2000, to less than 2.4 million in 2012; most of nation's 22.7 million veterans are eligible for membership.
lead_paragraph: In American Legion halls across the country, old age, apathy and budget deficits have become the enemies of an organization seeking to overhaul its image and increase membership.

headline.main: An Aging American Legion Fights for Relevancy
